metadata.Title: CVE-2017-5884 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
gtk-vnc before 0.7.0 does not properly check boundaries of subrectangle-containing tiles, which allows remote servers to execute arbitrary code via the src x, y coordinates in a crafted (1) rre, (2) hextile, or (3) copyrect tile.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-5884` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

gir1.2-gtk-vnc-2.0 - 0.5.3-0ubuntu2.1
gvncviewer - 0.5.3-0ubuntu2.1
libgtk-vnc-1.0-0 - 0.5.3-0ubuntu2.1
libgtk-vnc-2.0-0 - 0.5.3-0ubuntu2.1
libgvnc-1.0-0 - 0.5.3-0ubuntu2.1
python-gtk-vnc - 0.5.3-0ubuntu2.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: gtk-vnc package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '0.5.3-0ubuntu2.1').
